H0.text: Cancer is the disease caused when proto‑oncogenes change into oncogenes.

H1.text: Infections are caused by proto‑oncogenes that can change into oncogenes.

H2.text: DNA is what proto‑oncogenes can change into oncogenes that cause.

H3.text: Mutations are what proto‑oncogenes can change into oncogenes that cause.

A4.text: Activated oncogenes can cause those cells designated for apoptosis to survive and proliferate instead.

A5.text: When overexpressed, proto-oncogenes can be inadvertently activated (turned on), which changes them to oncogenes.
